answers.answer: Are you charting your cycles or checking your cervical mucus to see when you ovulate? Usually after you have been trying for a year with no luck, you can make an appointment with you gyn. and he can do some tests to see what the problem is. since your periods are irregular, you could probably make an appt. now. He will probably want your husband to make an appt. w/ an urologist to get him checked also. A lot of women here track their cycles at www.fertilityfriend.com. You should check out that website. The best thing that you can do for yourself right now is to get to know your body, how you feel when you ovulate, if there is a pattern with your periods.As for positions, mission is the best fpr conceiving, and oral sex is out because saliva kills sperm.
I've never heard that about oral sex! Thanks for the tip, you learn new things everyday! Husband will be disappointed though ;)

I don't know about anyone else.  But I know what you are coming from.  After my second miscarriage my periods became few and far in between.  Only 4 to 6 a year.  I was told it was my hormones or weight.  I was started on birth control.  Which usually ended up making me sick.  And I ended up stopping it..  I was tested for PCOS but was told that I didn't have it..  Then they said that the problem might be diabetes, but again that was not the problem..  Well I moved to another town and got with a new doctor.   I had a period for over a month and got scared.  He tried me on a new birth control.  And said we would try that if it didn't work then we would weigh our options.  Well I didn't adhere to the directions.  And got pregnant on my first pack of birth control.  Boy was the doctor shocked.
No problem:) I can't remember where I seen that, I think I read it in a book or on a ttc website. You would not think saliva would kill sperm, but I guess it does!!
Sorry I also found out that I have a retroverted uterus.  The doctor said it meant that the opening of the uterus is tilted up and that it might be a reason I had a hard time getting pregnant.
Thank you guys for all the comments and i did not know that about the sperm thing. well i already went to the doctor and they said that there is nothing wrong.

question: Hi,Me and my husband have been trying to concieve for about 9 months and still we are unable to concieve. I also have irregular periods (every 2 to 3 months). Does that effect my chances of getting pregnant and what can i do about that. I also wanted to ask if there are any sexual positions that help concieve. I am Hispanic and i have heard about women drinking teas that help concieve is this true or just superstition. If anyone has any coments or advice feel free to reply.
title: Trying to concieve.....
